meanings.definition: To remove a belt or belts from (someone or something).
meanings.sent1: She unbelts her dress before going to bed.
meanings.sent2: He unbelts his pants after a long day at work.
meanings.sent3: The magician unbelts the volunteer to free them from the magic trick.
meanings.sent4: The hero unbelts the captured princess from the evil villain's grasp.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic unbelts the engine to inspect it closely.

meanings.definition: To loosen or undo a belt or belts.
meanings.sent1: He unbelts his bag to search for his keys.
meanings.sent2: She unbelts her robe before stepping into the shower.
meanings.sent3: The hiker unbelts his backpack to take a break on the trail.
meanings.sent4: The weightlifter unbelts his belt to lift the heavy barbell.
meanings.sent5: The child unbelts the toy sword from their waist to play freely.

meanings.definition: To release or free from a belt or belts.
meanings.sent1: The firefighter unbelts the trapped victim from the car wreckage.
meanings.sent2: She unbelts the safety harness after finishing the climb.
meanings.sent3: The astronaut unbelts from the spaceship to float in zero gravity.
meanings.sent4: The knight unbelts the sword from his waist to defend the castle.
meanings.sent5: The swimmer unbelts the life jacket before diving into the pool.
